Gregor J. Rothfuss wrote:

> i'd like to put the xhtml + dc relax ng schemas in the core.


+1

> config/doctypes/schemas/
>
> and change the publications to use a resource-exists action to override the
schema if necessary.


We could set

    /lenya/resources/schemas
    /lenya/pubs/{mypub}/lenya/resources/schemas

as the locations for schemas. This way, the schemas could
be delivered by the core (FallbackModule) and used / shared
by doctypes. I don't think that a schema is necessarily related
to a doctype.

-- Andreas

Torsten

>> I don't think that a schema is necessarily related
>> to a doctype.
>> 
>> -- Andreas

> I guess you meant: a schema is not related to a PUBLICATION?
> Otherwise this does not make sense to me.

No, I meant "doctype". A schema can be used for non-doctype purposes (e.g.,
validating a workflow history document). Furthermore, schemas can be shared /
included by multiple doctypes. I guess it makes sense to distinct between
doctype and schema.
